scene: A sequence of continuous action in a play, movie, or book.
The place where an incident occurs or occurred.
chapter: A main division of a book, typically with a number or title.
plot: The main events of a play, novel, or movie, devised and presented by the writer.
character: A person in a novel, play, or movie.
motif: A distinctive feature or dominant idea in an artistic or literary composition.
protagonist: The leading character or one of the major characters.
antagonist: A person who actively opposes or is hostile to someone or something; an adversary.
synopsis: A brief summary or general survey of something.
outline: A general description or plan showing the essential features of something but not the detail.
narrator: A person who narrates something, especially a character who recounts the events of a novel or narrative poem.
